faqs.question: How does my septic system affect Lake Granbury?
faqs.answer: Septic effluent travels through the soil to groundwater, which eventually feeds the lake and Brazos River system. Sandy loam provides moderate filtration, but excess solids from an overfull tank can contaminate these water resources. Regular pumping keeps solids contained and protects the lake water quality.

faqs.question: How often should Granbury lake homes be pumped?
faqs.answer: Full-time residences should pump every three to five years. Weekend and seasonal lake homes should pump every three to four years despite lower total use, because intermittent occupancy can stress bacterial populations and cause uneven sludge accumulation. Proximity to the lake also warrants more conservative scheduling.
